channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14322] Master still not using more than it's priority threads
item.description:
Master and regionserver will be running as the same user.
Superusers by default adds the current user as a super user.
Super users' requests always go to the priority threads.
item.summary: Master still not using more than it's priority threads

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12752679/HBASE-14322.patch
against master branch at commit 56890d9fe148dd192520fab349a66aa3f688e232.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12752679

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 javac. The patch appears to cause mvn compile goal to fail with Hadoop version 2.4.0.

Compilation errors resume:

Could you rephrase this? I'm trying to follow what exactly gets blocked?

// If meta is moving then all the rest of report the report state transitions will be
58 // blocked. We shouldn't be in the same queue.
Sure. Basically reporting that a region is in transition needs to access meta. If reporting that meta is online is stuck behind requests trying to access meta, then everything times out and fails.

Ping?

This is running in production for us. It made it possible to restart the master while doing a rolling deploy (even if things are still weird they work with this patch).

Sorry for delay, thanks for clarification, I see now - basically the piece to handle region transition reports about system tables was there before, but misplaced in AnnotationReadingPriorityFunction so when requests are coming from admin user, we never get this code path. Let me take a look a bit more.

Looks good to me, +1.

Few nits - QosTestHelper needs audience annotation and some class javadoc? Also unused import in newly added test;

I'd consider adding you first comment ("Basically reporting that a region is in transition needs to access meta. If reporting that meta is online is stuck behind requests trying to access meta, then everything times out and fails.") to javadoc somethere in MAPRF?
Patch LGTM too (after what Mikhail said). If master carrying regions, might want to save on doubled annotation parse... we'll look at header twice... small potatoes if admin-only ops.

we'll look at header twice... small potatoes if admin-only ops.

That's why MasterAnnotationReadingPriorityFunction calls getBasePriority so that you only look at the annotations once. Or am I mis-understanding what you're saying?

I'd consider adding you first comment to javadoc somethere

Yeah let me do that before commit.
Patch with more javadoc explanation.
